page.title: 05LUNAN AREA, TRANSPORT.
page.content: There are two main roads in this area, both of which run north-east. The B road runs along the lower ground near to the coast and through Lunan Village, whilst the A92 runs along the higher ground approximately 500 metres inland. Minor roads and paths connect the two at various points. The only public transport to use the B road is the school bus which takes the primary school children to Inverkeilor school.The Dundee to Aberdeen bus runs hourly along the A92 road, where there are request bus stops. The long distance buses also use this route but only pick up passengers at the major towns. The main railway line of the British Rail Scottish Region to Aberdeen runs through this section but Lunan station was closed in 1932.
